oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Negotiating the past, the present and the future: No end-state
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: du Pisani, André
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The current framework agreement between Namibia and Germany illustrates the primacy of justice and fairness in negotiations, while at the same time, tells the story of how difficult it is to substantively satisfy notions of justice and fairness. From a principled perspective of moral philosophy, it is even more difficult to answer the interdependent questions of justice and fairness, especially if negotiations deal with the presence of the past, the future, and with genocide – killing by design, annihilating the sanctity of Life itself.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Journal of Namibian Studies : History Politics Culture; Vol. 29 (2021); 131-133
